results.title: Yentl
results.creator_credit: Barbra Streisand, Rusty Lemorande, Barwood Films, Ladbroke Entertainment and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the short story “Yentl, the Yeshiva boy” by Isaac Bashevis Singer, this is the poignant tale of a young European Jewish woman (Barbara Streisand), circa 1904, who disguises herself as a boy in order to pursue her passion for studying holy scripture, an endeavour restricted exclusively to men in orthodox Jewish culture. As the education of women is prohibited in her society, she must keep her identity a secret. The strangely deceptive world this creates poses many challenges for this intrepid character who, in overcoming them, proves that nothing is impossible. The making of this modern classic was a milestone, not only for its main creative force, the legendary Streisand, but for motion picture history. “Yentl” marked the first time that a woman had produced, co-written, directed and starred in a major feature film.

constellations_other.name: What's in a name?
constellations_other.description: Pakeezah (1972) star Meena Kumari was not just 'the tragedy queen' of Hindi film – she also wrote poetry under the pseudonym Naaz. From famous families and stage names to gendered disguises, this Constellation explores how women have adopted different names and identities to facilitate their ambition.

results.title: Rollerball
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: The next war not will be fought - it will be played. The year is 2018. There are no wars. There is no crime. There is only “The Game”. In a world ruled by Corporations, where no-one asks questions, the vicious barbaric “sport” of Rollerball distracts the masses and satisfies their violent and potentially rebellious impulses. Jonathon E., (James Caan), is the champion Rollerball player, but in a world governed by an elite, there is no place for an individual, let alone an icon of heroic achievement. Threatened by the head of the Corporation, (John Houseman), deprived of the woman he loves, (Maud Adams), Jonathan E. must make the choice to “quit while he’s ahead” or suffer the consequences. In an arena, where there are no rules, there can only be one winner. A sci-fi thriller with a chilling climax.

results.title: Black rain
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, Sherry Lansing, Stanley R. Jaffe and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Nick Conklin, (Michael Douglas) and Charlie Douglas, (Andy Garcia) are strangers in a strange land. They are New York City cops in Japan, chasing Sato, (Yasuka Matsuda), an escaped murderer and a member of the Yakuza, (the Japanese Mafia). Director Ridley Scott takes the viewer on nightmare journey through the exotic, violent streets of Osaka, into the very heart of the deadly Yakuza. This fascinating thriller tells of men torn by a clash of culture and crime against honour.

results.title: The Paper
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Frederick Zollo and Imagine Entertainment (US)
results.brief_description: Today, Henry Hackett (Michael Keaton), Metro editor of a New York tabloid has to make big decisions. His heavily pregnant wife (Marisa Tomei) is facing urgent deadlines of her own. Henry’s boss, the managing editor (Glenn Close) is also reaching a crisis in her life and her senior (Robert Duvall) has just discovered he is an extremely sick man. To top it all, the paper is in pursuit of a hot story that could expose a major scandal and free two innocent boys charged with murder if they can beat the deadline. With the clock ticking, the tension mounts and somewhere amidst the chaos are moments that could change these people’s lives forever. Directed by Ron Howard and also starring Randy Quaid, this film is an inside look at the ruthless and sometimes savage newspaper business.

results.title: Harvey
results.creator_credit: Henry Koster, John Beck and Universal International Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the Pulitzer prize play written by Mary Chase, James Stewart gives one of his finest performances as Elwood P. Dowd. A good-natured soul, his constant companion is a six-foot-eight rabbit called Harvey, who is only visible to Elwood. To his sister, Veta Louise, Elwood’s obsession with Harvey has been a thorn in the side of her plans to marry off her daughter. When she finally decides to commit Elwood to a mental institution, an hilarious mix-up results in her own committal. Elwood and his imaginary friend finally make things right. At the start of this video, Jimmy Stewart talks about the film and his long association with “Harvey”.

results.title: Monkey business
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Sol Siegel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Marilyn Monroe, Cary Grant, Ginger Rogers and Charles Coburn star in the zany Howard Hawks comedy about a chemist who discovers a potent rejuvenation drug. Dr. Barnaby Fulton is a staid scientist working on a youth restoring serum with no success when one of the laboratory chimpanzees accidentally concocts the formula. Fulton and his wife try it with hilarious results and successive doses result in increasingly more juvenile behaviour. When others taste the potion, including Fulton’s stuffy boss and his voluptuous secretary, the laboratory really goes wild!

results.title: The Beguiled
results.creator_credit: Don Siegel, Malpaso Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A wounded Union soldier is discovered by a young student from a crumbling Louisiana girls’ school during the Civil War. The academy takes their prize in and cares for him, and the cunning, mysterious soldier uses the all-female situation to coolly play off each of his captors to his own advantage. This carefully manuoevred sexual powderkeg finally explodes and the film spirals downwards into a pit of released repression and psychological horror. Stars Clint Eastwood and Geraldine Page. Based on the novel by Thomas Cullinan.

results.title: Barton Fink
results.creator_credit: Joel Coen, Ethan Coen and Circle Films
results.brief_description: New York City, 1941. Barton Fink is a successful Hollywood writer who has come to the land of the rich and famous to make it big in the movies. However, now that Hollywood has embraced him, he finds himself suffering from a severe case of writer’s block, has a movie mogul with a passion for wrestling breathing down his neck, and an insane insurance salesman wanting to separate his head from his neck. An enormously amusing crackpot view of the underside of the Hollywood dream and a wonderful, if slightly bizarre, investigation of the creative mind in turmoil. Cast includes John Turturro, John Goodman, Judy Davis, Michael Lerner and John Mahoney.

results.title: At play in the fields of the Lord
results.creator_credit: Hector Babenco, Saul Zaentz and Saul Zaentz Company
results.brief_description: Tom Berenger, Daryl Hannah and Aidan Quinn star in a powerful story of mercenaries, missionaries and a tribe of primitive Indians who clash in fanatical conflict in the remote and unforgiving forest of Amazonia. A tragic chain of events is set in motion when the modern world intrudes on the rainforest and its indigenous people. Shot entirely on location in the Amazon forest.

results.title: The Bedford incident
results.creator_credit: James B. Harris, Richard Widmark, Bedford Productions and Columbia
results.brief_description: During a routine peacetime patrol in the Greenland Straits, the USS Bedford’s sonar picks up an unidentified submarine. The destroyer’s commander, Captain Finlander, (Richard Widmark), relentlessly pursues the lurking sub as a training exercise for his crew, keeping his men at battle stations for hours. Top-flight photo-journalist, Ben Munceford (Sidney Poitier) and NATO observer Schrepke (Eric Portman), try to warn him about this dangerous game, however Finlander is determined to win at all costs. A gripping “Cold War” classic.
